hedline.hl1: Adjuncts as Qualified As Full-Time Professors

abstract.p: Paul Ash letter disputes contention in May 7 article that adjunct professors are not as qualified as full-time college professors (S)

block.p: As a retired high school teacher and longtime adjunct at various colleges, I applaud ''Adjunct Professors: Low Pay And Hard Going'' [May 7].

I take exception, however, to a misstatement of fact the author attributes to Charles Fleischman of Hofstra University, referring to the adjuncts not bringing the level of expertise the colleges require and to their lesser experience.
As a retired high school teacher and longtime adjunct at various colleges, I applaud ''Adjunct Professors: Low Pay And Hard Going'' [May 7].

I take exception, however, to a misstatement of fact the author attributes to Charles Fleischman of Hofstra University, referring to the adjuncts not bringing the level of expertise the colleges require and to their lesser experience.

The truth of the matter is that a considerable number of adjuncts hold doctorates and most have had more years in the classroom than full-time college teachers. In my own case, I have spent half a century in the profession, including 11 years as an adjunct at Hofstra.
